item.title: Top-down derivation of Electromagnetism
item.description: Relativity’s action principle constrains how light and matter interact within spacetime. By placing the potential term either inside or outside the action square root, we derive the familiar interactions of gravity or electromagnetism between matter. This post offers a top-down view of electromagnetism’s derivation from these fundamental principles. Relativistic Action To incorporate relativistic effects, the action is written as: $$ S = -m \int{ \sqrt{-\eta_{\mu \nu} dx^{\mu} dx^{\nu}} } = -m \sqrt{dt^{2} - d\vec{x}^{2}} $$
